threat: A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to create a denial of service via disk consumption.
If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to view sensitive information.
A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to obtain root disk snapshot contents via ephemeral storage.
A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to read host files.
In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt guest AppArmor profile.
